meanings.definition: The act of making something English in character or form.
meanings.sent1: The anglicization of the menu made it easier for tourists to understand.
meanings.sent2: The anglicization of her name from Maria to Mary was done for convenience.
meanings.sent3: The anglicization of the traditional dance with a modern twist was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The anglicization of the ancient ritual breathed new life into the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The anglicization of the recipe brought a familiar taste to the foreign dish.

meanings.definition: The process of converting words or names into a form more typical of English.
meanings.sent1: The anglicization of the street signs helped non-native speakers navigate the city.
meanings.sent2: The anglicization of the surname Smithson simplified its pronunciation.
meanings.sent3: The anglicization of the foreign words into English was a fun linguistic exercise.
meanings.sent4: The anglicization of the technical terms made the manual easier to understand.
meanings.sent5: The anglicization of the lyrics made the song resonate with a wider audience.
